hu.sztaki.sztakipediaparser.wiki.converter
Class DefaultWikiConverter

java.lang.Object
  hu.sztaki.sztakipediaparser.wiki.converter.DefaultWikiConverter
All Implemented Interfaces:
IWikiConverter
public class DefaultWikiConverter
extends Object
implements IWikiConverter

Converter class.

This class builds and stores the abstract syntax tree during the parsing process. Provides methods for the parser to add nodes to the tree. It can preprocess the original wikitext and postprocess the finished AST. It is also responsible for the generation of the html output from the AST.

Since:
2011
Author:
Tibor Olah, MTA SZTAKI

addExternalLinkTag

public void addExternalLinkTag(String url,
                               String alias,
                               boolean plainlink,
                               String wikitext)
Description copied from interface: IWikiConverter
Appends an external link to the output buffer. See Links and URLs

Specified by:
addExternalLinkTag in interface IWikiConverter
Parameters:
url - URL of the link. The validity of the url is NOT checked by the parser.
alias - Display name of the url.
plainlink - Plainlink URL.
wikitext - Original raw wikitext of the tag.

addInternalLinkTag

public void addInternalLinkTag(String url,
                               ArrayList<String> params,
                               String wikitext)
Description copied from interface: IWikiConverter
Appends an internal wiki link to the output buffer. e.g. [[Texas|Lone Star State]] Everey link is treated as internal if it begins with double brackets, so File:, Media: and special links are also internal. The method has to figure out which link is which from the url parameter and decide what to do with it.

Specified by:
addInternalLinkTag in interface IWikiConverter
Parameters:
url - It is not an URL but the name of the article to link to.
params - Parameters of the internal link tag. Can be just an alias or an array of image parameters.
wikitext - The raw wikitext.

setBeginEnd

public void setBeginEnd(boolean setBeginEnd)
Description copied from interface: IWikiConverter
Sets the setBeginEnd postprocessor switch. If the switch is true, then the character position of the beginning and ending of String tags are stored in the output HTML.

Specified by:
setBeginEnd in interface IWikiConverter
